units.name: AquilaMacroCannon
units.description: Massive fortification with a devastating long-range cannon.
units.flavour: Macro-cannon Aquila Strongpoints are massive fortifications, often used as bastions in Imperial defensive battle lines. Each consists of a munitions silo, topped by a large turret that houses the huge macro-cannon that gives the strongpoint its name.

units.name: Apothecary
units.description: Infantry unit that heals allied infantry.
units.flavour: These courageous field-surgeons face the full heat of battle, their nartheciums healing even grievous injuries, and their vials of combat stimms and anticoagulants quickly getting wounded brothers back into the fight. They also administer the Emperor's grace to those beyond help, extracting the progenoid glands containing the gene-seed so that the Space Marine's legacy might live on.

units.name: AssaultSpaceMarine
units.description: Melee infantry unit equipped with jump packs to overcome terrain obstacles.
units.flavour: The howl of jump pack turbines heralds the meteoric descent of the Assault Marines. Plunging from the sky with bolt pistols blazing, they slam into their foes like a hurricane of destruction. Screaming victims are thrown to the ground, bodies crushed beneath ceramite boots, chests ripped open by snarling chainswords. Within moments the killing is done, and the Assault Marines bound onwards, leaving behind them a ragged wound torn in the enemy's battle line.

units.name: Captain
units.description: Legendary hero unit that excels in close combat.
units.flavour: Amid the fire and thunder of the front lines, Space Marine Captains set a peerless example to their brothers as they carve down one enemy after another. Each Captain is a skilled warrior, a veteran of hundreds of battles who has slain whole armies of foes during his celebrated career.

units.name: DevastatorCenturion
units.description: Very bulky infantry unit with massive armaments.
units.flavour: Devastator Centurions pound their enemies with a remorseless, relentless rain of fire. Bloody havoc is wrought upon anything that falls within the Centurions’ targeting reticules. The pilots’ marksmanship is augmented by the grim machine spirits of their warsuits, decimator protocols guiding servo-assisted recoil absorption and oracular auto-targeting to ensure the Centurions maintain a punishing rate of fire. Return fire is a futile gesture, akin to flinging stones at a fortress, for should the enemy launch an assault in an attempt to silence the Devastator Centurions’ guns they must contend with the suits’ massive strength and the pilots’ skill at arms.

units.name: Dreadnought
units.description: Heavy walker unit that crushes opponents in close combat.
units.flavour: The ground shakes at the advance of a Space Marine Dreadnought. With its mighty power fist and blazing heavy weapon, this armoured war engine tramples a path of destruction through its foes.

units.name: Chaplain
units.description: Zealous hero unit that raises morale and inspires loyalty.
units.flavour: To meet the baleful gaze of a Space Marine Chaplain is to know that death itself will soon follow. These terrifying warrior-priests can be found wherever the fighting is thickest, inspiring their brothers to greatness with every thunderous blow and roared exhortation.

units.name: DevastatorSpaceMarine
units.description: Infantry unit equipped to bring down heavy war machines.
units.flavour: The battlefield echoes to the furious roar of heavy weapons as the Devastators open fire. No matter the target, no matter the odds, a Devastator Squad carries sufficient firepower to obliterate their enemies in a matter of moments. Even mighty war engines cannot stand against these deadly-accurate support troopers, shuddering to a blazing, explosion-wracked halt beneath the concentrated volleys of the Devastators.

units.name: FortressOfRedemption
units.description: Fortification that automatically gathers resources from adjacent special resource features.
units.flavour: A Fortress of Redemption is a towering bulwark against the ravages of planetary invasion. Each is virtually impervious to conventional firepower and the lower levels, bunker annexes and sub-crypts can house entire platoons of battle-ready warriors. First used by the Dark Angels Legion during the days of the Great Crusade, they have since been used by every military force in the Imperium and proven invaluable to its defence.

units.name: Headquarters
units.description: Headquarters unit that represents the fortress city's defenses.
units.flavour: Every fortress-monastery contains myriad halls large enough to house several armies, but most have too a Great Hall, centerpiece of a Chapter's home. Trophies, relics and even its most revered spacecraft may be housed within the Great Hall. If the sight of the Great Hall does not reduce a visitor to dumbfounded silence, then it has failed in its purpose.

units.name: Hunter
units.description: Tank unit that is specialized in taking down skimmers and flyers.
units.flavour: From out of its massive turreted warhead chamber, the Hunter sends skyspear missiles thundering into the heavens. Emitting a piercing scream as it tears across the firmament, each of these sacred rounds seeks out the skyborne foes of the Emperor. Entombed in the heart of each missile, a servitor savant guides the ordnance to its foe. Even if the missile flies wide of its mark, the hard-wired savant will set it back on course.

units.name: LandRaider
units.description: Massively armoured and heavily armed transport unit.
units.flavour: The ground trembles and enemies flee in fear as the mighty Land Raider advances into battle. Massively armoured and all but unstoppable, the noble war engine smashes through walls and grinds over wreckage while drumming volley after volley of fire into the foe. Beams of incandescent energy slam into enemy tanks, knifing through their armoured hulls and reducing them to blazing fireballs. Thudding bolt shells punch into the flesh of the foe before detonating in shocking sprays of gore. The kill count climbs with each passing moment as the Land Raider advances across the war zone, especially once the tank's assault ramp slams down and its Adeptus Astartes passengers charge out to add to the carnage.

units.name: Librarian
units.description: Hero unit with versatile psychic powers.
units.flavour: Eyes blazing and fists crackling with the roiling energies of the Warp, Space Marine Librarians stride into battle to destroy their foes. Some hurl blasts of force that crush their victims to paste, while others twist the flow of time itself, or revitalise their brothers with incredible surges of vitality. However they choose to fight, all Librarians are powerful psykers, harnessing the potent mutation they bear as a force to defend Humanity.

units.name: LandSpeeder
units.description: Mobile hover vehicle unit that can even traverse water.
units.flavour: Skimming over the battlefield at breakneck speeds, Land Speeders bank and roll with incredible agility. Able to navigate tangled urban ruins, narrow-sided canyons, and even to weave through dense forest canopies, the Land Speeder possesses unrivalled manoeuvrability. This is enhanced by the superhuman reflexes of its Space Marine crew, and capitalised upon through the incorporation of resilient, if light, armour and an arsenal of heavy weapons.

units.name: Predator
units.description: Main battle tank unit.
units.flavour: A swift and brutal fighting vehicle, the Predator provides the Space Marine Chapters with prodigious amounts of fire support. The battle tank's heavy bolters and autocannon are the bane of infantry and light vehicles, while the Annihilator variant's lascannons spell doom to any armoured enemy.

units.name: StormravenGunship
units.description: Heavily armed and armoured airborne transport unit.
units.flavour: Stormraven Gunships streak into battle with their weapons blazing, flak whipping around them as they rake the foe with bolts, blasts and warheads. More akin to a flying tank than a conventional dropship, the Stormraven is the most versatile aircraft in the arsenal of the Adeptus Astartes. Fast, manoeuvrable, resilient, boasting prodigious firepower and a substantial transport capacity, the Stormraven can perform many different roles.

units.name: ScoutBiker
units.description: Fast reconnaissance unit.
units.flavour: Racing across the blasted battlegrounds of the 41st Millennium, Scout Bikers use their speed and manoeuvrability to outflank and outwit their foes. Shadowing their enemies' movements, the Scout Bikers probe for weaknesses and assess the foe's intentions. Only once the element of surprise is guaranteed do they strike, roaring suddenly from concealment with guns blazing.

units.name: Razorback
units.description: Tank unit that transports infantry.
units.flavour: The Razorback rolls into battle with its weapons charged and ready to fire. Its determined crew slam their vehicle through obstacles and over wreckage, keeping pace with the Adeptus Astartes’ advance. Meanwhile, inside the vehicle’s transport bay, its passengers ready themselves for the battle ahead.

units.name: StormtalonGunship
units.description: Airborne interceptor and ground-attack unit.
units.flavour: The smaller Stormtalon Gunship is incredibly fast and agile, and makes a superb air-interceptor and ground attack craft. With a single press of a trigger, the Stormtalon's pilot purges his victims from existence amid a whistling hail of missiles, bolts and las blasts. All the while, the Stormtalon jinks and weaves with incredible speed, enemy fire slicing around it to no avail.

units.name: Terminator
units.description: Heavily armoured infantry unit that can take on virtually every ground opponent.
units.flavour: Near invincible and utterly indomitable, Terminators undertake those missions that even their power-armoured brethren cannot. Whether it be an unsupported strike into the heart of an enemy fortress, or hunting super-heavy war engines on foot, these heroic 1st Company Veterans are equal to the task.

units.name: ThunderfireCannon
units.description: Infantry unit that provides long-range barrage support and can clear tiles and repair vehicles.
units.flavour: These colossal, quad-barrelled artillery guns are designed to excel in a static defence role. Each is capable of firing and reloading at a punishing rate, unleashing salvo after salvo of high explosive shells, pounding the enemy into oblivion. Only the brave or the foolish dare advance in the face of such overwhelming and obliterating firepower.

units.name: TacticalSpaceMarine
units.description: Versatile infantry unit.
units.flavour: Where an objective must be seized, Tactical Squads attack in a storm of gunfire and combat blades. Where the line must be held, these courageous warriors plant their feet, raise their weapons, and fight to the last. Armed with boltguns and grenades, Tactical Squads are superbly versatile strategic assets.

units.name: Vindicator
units.description: Heavy tank unit with a devastating close-range cannon.
units.flavour: The Vindicator is a short-ranged sledgehammer of a vehicle, a siege tank whose massive demolisher cannon can reduce any target to a smoking crater. The Vindicator is especially favoured by the Imperial Fists, who regularly field whole squadrons of these tanks and rely upon their concentrated volleys to blast open fortress walls, flatten gun-nests and bunkers, and lay low super-heavy war engines.

buildings.name: Aircraft
buildings.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates requisitions and influence.
buildings.flavour: Staging area for the Chapter's aerial assault craft and transports, from whence battle-brothers may embark upon their endless crusade. The fortress-monastery's active gunships, interceptors, landing craft and even its mighty Thunderhawks are housed in a hive of hangars below the launch pads.

buildings.name: Energy
buildings.flavour: Though the light of the Emperor is the true source of every Chapter's strength, a physical power source is also required. The exact nature of its Generatorum differs from Chapter to Chapter. The Space Wolves, for instance, have driven immense crystal shafts deep into the surface of the planet Fenris, transforming subterranean heat into the endless energy their fortress-monastery demands.

buildings.name: GeneseedBunker
buildings.description: Building that stores the geneseed of your chapter and generates influence.
buildings.flavour: Using all of the secrets of the machine spirits, Techmarines have designed these bunkers to be shielded in every possible way—physically, electromagnetically and psychically. It will take the labour of hundreds of heavy Servitors, but even if a Chapter's warriors die to a man, the Apothecaries and geneseed in these bunkers will be able to resurrect it… eventually.

buildings.name: Construction
buildings.description: Building that constructs new buildings and generates influence.
buildings.flavour: In normal times, the various Teleportaria would be used to transport troops to and from nearby starships. In these warptorn times, the Orbital Relay serves a more important function, communicating with the low-orbiting Battle Barge and calling down important requisitions for rapid surface deployment.

buildings.name: Headquarters
buildings.flavour: Every fortress-monastery contains myriad halls large enough to house several armies, but most have too a Great Hall, centerpiece of a Chapter's home. Trophies, relics and even its most revered spacecraft may be housed within the Great Hall. If the sight of the Great Hall does not reduce a visitor to dumbfounded silence, then it has failed in its purpose.

buildings.name: Heroes
buildings.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: For those rare ceremonies that require the attendance of every Battle Brother, the vastness of the Reclusiam allows the entire Chapter to gather. This is the most precious place in a fortress-monastery—home to its most sacred relics and, in a rare few, the very body of its Primarch. It is also the seat of the chapter's commanders and heroes.

buildings.name: Housing
buildings.flavour: Though each Battle-Brother receives his own personal cell, those members of a Chapter who do not directly enforce the will of the Emperor share communal quarters spread across the fortress-monastery. Support staff including servants, nurses and technicians call these stark dormitories home.

buildings.name: Influence
buildings.flavour: An immense and high-ceilinged gathering-place, wherein every member of the Chapter may assemble to attend briefings, ceremonies and even feasts of particular import. In most fortress-monasteries, the Great Hall is the only room to exceed the sheer size of the Assimularum.

buildings.name: Loyalty
buildings.flavour: Here the Chaplains tend to the spiritual well-being of their charges, ensuring the discipline of every Marine and keeping their minds and spirits pure. In order to accommodate this, each of the Chapter's ten Companies has its own dedicated chapel. Greater ceremonies take place in the Reclusiam itself.

buildings.name: Infantry
buildings.description: Building that produces infantry as well as increases population limit and generates research.
buildings.flavour: The Apothecarion provides medical support for wounded Battle-Brothers, and plays a vital role in the elevation of an Aspirant to a Space Marine. Both these functions pale into insignificance against the Apothecarion's other purpose—the preservation of its Chapter's unique gene-seed, from which new Space Marines are created. If the gene-seed is lost, so too is the Chapter.

buildings.name: Requisitions
buildings.flavour: The Chapter's mammoth dining halls and kitchens are contained within its Refectories. The Space Marine diet is a spartan affair, augmented with a cocktail of bio-chemical supplements to ensure constant battle-readiness. The Battle-Brothers consume this repast in complete silence.

buildings.name: Research
buildings.flavour: Though also a store for extensive written histories of its Chapter, the Librarium is first and foremost its central command, communications and defence station. Here, Astropaths manage external and intra-base comms, while Librarians and psykers pore over, protect and update the Chapter's centuries of wisdom.

buildings.name: Vehicles
buildings.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates requisitions and research.
buildings.flavour: Home to anything that a Marine might employ to purge the battlefield of xenos and heretics, from the simplest combat knife to the most redoubtable of relics. The Master of Ordnance keeps a close watch upon the Chapter's wargear—only his gene-print can grant access to this titanic underground repository of weapons and vehicles.

upgrades.name: Aircraft
upgrades.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates requisitions and influence.
upgrades.flavour: Staging area for the Chapter's aerial assault craft and transports, from whence battle-brothers may embark upon their endless crusade. The fortress-monastery's active gunships, interceptors, landing craft and even its mighty Thunderhawks are housed in a hive of hangars below the launch pads.

upgrades.name: Apothecary
upgrades.description: Infantry unit that heals allied infantry.
upgrades.flavour: These courageous field-surgeons face the full heat of battle, their nartheciums healing even grievous injuries, and their vials of combat stimms and anticoagulants quickly getting wounded brothers back into the fight. They also administer the Emperor's grace to those beyond help, extracting the progenoid glands containing the gene-seed so that the Space Marine's legacy might live on.

upgrades.name: AquilaMacroCannon
upgrades.description: Massive fortification with a devastating long-range cannon.
upgrades.flavour: Macro-cannon Aquila Strongpoints are massive fortifications, often used as bastions in Imperial defensive battle lines. Each consists of a munitions silo, topped by a large turret that houses the huge macro-cannon that gives the strongpoint its name.

upgrades.name: AssaultDoctrine
upgrades.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Assault Space Marines.
upgrades.flavour:
“Where there is uncertainty, I shall bring light
Where there is doubt, I shall sow faith.
Where there is shame, I shall point atonement.
Where there is rage, I shall show its course.
My word in the soul shall be as my bolter in the field.”
— Litany of Devotion, traditional

upgrades.name: AssaultSpaceMarine
upgrades.description: Melee infantry unit equipped with jump packs to overcome terrain obstacles.
upgrades.flavour: The howl of jump pack turbines heralds the meteoric descent of the Assault Marines. Plunging from the sky with bolt pistols blazing, they slam into their foes like a hurricane of destruction. Screaming victims are thrown to the ground, bodies crushed beneath ceramite boots, chests ripped open by snarling chainswords. Within moments the killing is done, and the Assault Marines bound onwards, leaving behind them a ragged wound torn in the enemy's battle line.

upgrades.name: BlastDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of grenade, missile and blast weapons.
upgrades.flavour: By using a more advanced engraving protocol on the casing, the lethality of explosive is much improved.

upgrades.name: BolsterDefences
upgrades.description: Grants Thunderfire Cannons the ability to increase the ranged damage reduction of the target tile.
upgrades.flavour:
“Every position must be held to the last man: there must be no retirement. With our backs to the wall, and believing in the justice of our cause, each one of us must fight on to the end.”
— Imperial Warmaster Solon

upgrades.name: BoltDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of bolt weapons.
upgrades.flavour: An Astartes-derived upgrade to the standard bolter, this kit allows a bolter to fire Kraken penetrator rounds, hard-tipped projectiles with a heavier explosive charge. These heavier rounds are much favoured by the Space Marine Deathwatch alien hunters.

upgrades.name: BolterDrill
upgrades.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of bolt weapons.
upgrades.flavour:
“I believe in three tenets of battle—firepower, firepower, and more firepower.”
— Kardan Stronos, Chapter Master of the Iron Hands

upgrades.name: CeramitePlating
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of Stormraven and Stormtalon Gunships.
upgrades.flavour: These hull plates are thrice-blessed by the Chapter's Techmarines and anointed with the seven sacred unguents of thermic warding to protect against the extreme conditions of orbital re-entry. Such precautions also serve to thwart the fury of certain weapons, absorbing and dispersing even the most extreme temperatures and microwave emissions.

upgrades.name: ChapterUnity
upgrades.description: Increases the loyalty output of the Great Hall.
upgrades.flavour: The relics housed in the Great Hall remind the Adeptus Astartes of the heroes of the past, and that one day their armour, weapons and bones could also be revered here.

upgrades.name: Chaplain
upgrades.description: Zealous hero unit that raises morale and inspires loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: To meet the baleful gaze of a Space Marine Chaplain is to know that death itself will soon follow. These terrifying warrior-priests can be found wherever the fighting is thickest, inspiring their brothers to greatness with every thunderous blow and roared exhortation.

upgrades.name: CityTier2
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of the city.
upgrades.flavour: The second stage of the Fortress' construction has started. With the core facilities established, the Techmarines are authorised to expand their operations and create a second defensive line.

upgrades.name: CityTier4
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius.
upgrades.flavour: With this expansion, the Master Artificer declares the fortress complete. Now it rivals in scale a Hive City. Inside its impregnable walls, you could be anywhere in the Imperium. Outside, the local tribes come from enormous distances to pay tribute, whilst their finest warriors hope to be accepted for the lethal trials that might lead to their being modified into a Space Marine.

upgrades.name: CityTier3
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius.
upgrades.flavour: The third stage of the Fortress construction involves the creation of independent garrisons and buttresses along an additional line of city walls. In the shadow of those cyclopean barriers, Servitors and serfs spend their lives, scurrying from one task to another.

upgrades.name: ClusterMines
upgrades.description: Grants Scout Bikers the ability to place cluster mines.
upgrades.flavour: While operating behind enemy lines, Scout Bikers carry cluster mines—explosive devices crammed with tiny anti-personnel bomblets and triggered by tripwires or pressure sensors.

upgrades.name: CombatShield
upgrades.description: Increases damage reduction of Assault Space Marines.
upgrades.flavour: A combat shield is a lighter version of the storm shield fitted to the wearer's vambrace, leaving their hand free to wield another weapon whilst providing protection from incoming attacks.

upgrades.name: Construction
upgrades.description: Building that constructs new buildings and generates influence.
upgrades.flavour: In normal times, the various Teleportaria would be used to transport troops to and from nearby starships. In these warptorn times, the Orbital Relay serves a more important function, communicating with the low-orbiting Battle Barge and calling down important requisitions for rapid surface deployment.

upgrades.name: DevastatorCenturion
upgrades.description: Very bulky infantry unit with massive armaments.
upgrades.flavour: Devastator Centurions pound their enemies with a remorseless, relentless rain of fire. Bloody havoc is wrought upon anything that falls within the Centurions’ targeting reticules. The pilots’ marksmanship is augmented by the grim machine spirits of their warsuits, decimator protocols guiding servo-assisted recoil absorption and oracular auto-targeting to ensure the Centurions maintain a punishing rate of fire. Return fire is a futile gesture, akin to flinging stones at a fortress, for should the enemy launch an assault in an attempt to silence the Devastator Centurions’ guns they must contend with the suits’ massive strength and the pilots’ skill at arms.

upgrades.name: DevastatorDoctrine
upgrades.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Devastator Space Marines and Devastator Centurions.
upgrades.flavour:
“Victory often rests on the correct weaponry being in the right place and at the right time. Even the most destructive weapons of war are worthless if absent from the battle.”
— Artor Amhrad, Chapter Master of the Astral Knights

upgrades.name: DevastatorSpaceMarine
upgrades.description: Infantry unit equipped to bring down heavy war machines.
upgrades.flavour: The battlefield echoes to the furious roar of heavy weapons as the Devastators open fire. No matter the target, no matter the odds, a Devastator Squad carries sufficient firepower to obliterate their enemies in a matter of moments. Even mighty war engines cannot stand against these deadly-accurate support troopers, shuddering to a blazing, explosion-wracked halt beneath the concentrated volleys of the Devastators.

upgrades.name: DozerBlade
upgrades.description: Reduces the movement penalty for Hunters, Predators and Razorbacks in forests and imperial ruins.
upgrades.flavour: Dozer blades are heavy ploughs, blades, rams, or scoops, used to clear obstacles from the vehicle's path.

upgrades.name: Dreadnought
upgrades.description: Heavy walker unit that crushes opponents in close combat.
upgrades.flavour: The ground shakes at the advance of a Space Marine Dreadnought. With its mighty power fist and blazing heavy weapon, this armoured war engine tramples a path of destruction through its foes.

upgrades.name: ExtraVehicleArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: When the proper unguents have been spread and blessings made, a Techmarine may well make some minor changes to his charges, in line with Codex Astartes of course, to improve survivability.

upgrades.name: FortressOfRedemptionMissileSilo
upgrades.description: Grants Fortresses of Redemption a krakstorm missile silo.
upgrades.flavour: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

upgrades.name: FragGrenade
upgrades.description: Grants Apothecaries, Assault Space Marines, Captains, Devastator Space Marines, Librarians, Scout Bikers, Tactical Space Marines and Thunderfire Cannons the ability to throw anti-infantry grenades.
upgrades.flavour: The lethal storm of shrapnel from these grenades drives opponents further under the cover for a few precious moments, allowing attackers more time to close in and, hopefully, get the first blow in against a disoriented foe.

upgrades.name: ExtraInfantryArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of infantry.
upgrades.flavour: Whilst purity seals may well keep an Adeptus Astartes in the field for longer, faith doesn't stop all bolts. By upgrading to later versions of their Power Armour, Space Marine infantry improve their survivability substantially.

upgrades.name: GeneseedBunker
upgrades.description: Building that stores the geneseed of your chapter and generates influence.
upgrades.flavour: Using all of the secrets of the machine spirits, Techmarines have designed these bunkers to be shielded in every possible way—physically, electromagnetically and psychically. It will take the labour of hundreds of heavy Servitors, but even if a Chapter's warriors die to a man, the Apothecaries and geneseed in these bunkers will be able to resurrect it… eventually.

upgrades.name: Heroes
upgrades.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: For those rare ceremonies that require the attendance of every Battle Brother, the vastness of the Reclusiam allows the entire Chapter to gather. This is the most precious place in a fortress-monastery—home to its most sacred relics and, in a rare few, the very body of its Primarch. It is also the seat of the chapter's commanders and heroes.

upgrades.name: Hunter
upgrades.description: Tank unit that is specialized in taking down skimmers and flyers.
upgrades.flavour: From out of its massive turreted warhead chamber, the Hunter sends skyspear missiles thundering into the heavens. Emitting a piercing scream as it tears across the firmament, each of these sacred rounds seeks out the skyborne foes of the Emperor. Entombed in the heart of each missile, a servitor savant guides the ordnance to its foe. Even if the missile flies wide of its mark, the hard-wired savant will set it back on course.

upgrades.name: Housing
upgrades.description: Building that increases population limit.
upgrades.flavour: Though each Battle-Brother receives his own personal cell, those members of a Chapter who do not directly enforce the will of the Emperor share communal quarters spread across the fortress-monastery. Support staff including servants, nurses and technicians call these stark dormitories home.

upgrades.name: HammerOfWrath
upgrades.description: Grants Assault Space Marines, Dreadnoughts and Scout Bikers the ability to perform more devastating attacks.
upgrades.flavour: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

upgrades.name: HunterKillerMissile
upgrades.description: Grants ground vehicles the ability to fire hunter-killer missiles.
upgrades.flavour: Hunter-killer missiles are commonly fitted to Imperial vehicles. These single-use weapon systems allow vehicles such as Rhinos to engage armoured enemy vehicles that would otherwise far outmatch them.

upgrades.name: HurricaneBolter
upgrades.description: Grants Stormraven Gunships a hurricane bolter.
upgrades.flavour: First used by the Black Templars Chapter, hurricane bolters combine the punishing firepower of multiple twin-linked boltguns to produce a truly withering storm of shells.

upgrades.name: KrakGrenade
upgrades.description: Grants Apothecaries, Assault Space Marines, Captains, Devastator Space Marines, Librarians, Scout Bikers, Tactical Space Marines and Thunderfire Cannons the ability to throw anti-armour grenades.
upgrades.flavour: Krak grenades are implosive charges designed to crack vehicle armour.

upgrades.name: LandRaider
upgrades.description: Massively armoured and heavily armed transport unit.
upgrades.flavour: The ground trembles and enemies flee in fear as the mighty Land Raider advances into battle. Massively armoured and all but unstoppable, the noble war engine smashes through walls and grinds over wreckage while drumming volley after volley of fire into the foe. Beams of incandescent energy slam into enemy tanks, knifing through their armoured hulls and reducing them to blazing fireballs. Thudding bolt shells punch into the flesh of the foe before detonating in shocking sprays of gore. The kill count climbs with each passing moment as the Land Raider advances across the war zone, especially once the tank's assault ramp slams down and its Adeptus Astartes passengers charge out to add to the carnage.

upgrades.name: LandSpeeder
upgrades.description: Mobile hover vehicle unit that can even traverse water.
upgrades.flavour: Skimming over the battlefield at breakneck speeds, Land Speeders bank and roll with incredible agility. Able to navigate tangled urban ruins, narrow-sided canyons, and even to weave through dense forest canopies, the Land Speeder possesses unrivalled manoeuvrability. This is enhanced by the superhuman reflexes of its Space Marine crew, and capitalised upon through the incorporation of resilient, if light, armour and an arsenal of heavy weapons.

upgrades.name: LandSpeederMultiMelta
upgrades.description: Grants Land Speeders and Land Raiders a multi-melta weapon.
upgrades.flavour: Melta weapons are lethal anti-armour guns, most effective at very short range. When fired, the super-heating of the air produces a distinctive and sinister hiss. Solid rock is reduced to molten slag, and living creatures are vaporised in an instant!

upgrades.name: LasDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of las weapons.
upgrades.flavour: These superior modular packs convert the standard lasgun into a 'Hellgun', with improved range and power, but reduced power pack capacity and degraded reliability, requiring constant maintenance. Even units that already have dedicated Hotshot lasguns benefit from more reliable Hotshot power pack supplies.

upgrades.name: LastStand
upgrades.description: Increases the morale of all Space Marine units.
upgrades.flavour:
“Here we stand and here shall we die, unbroken and unbowed. Though the very hand of death itself come for us, we will spit our defiance to the end!”
— Chaplain Armand Titus of the Howling Griffons

upgrades.name: Librarian
upgrades.description: Hero unit with versatile psychic powers.
upgrades.flavour: Eyes blazing and fists crackling with the roiling energies of the Warp, Space Marine Librarians stride into battle to destroy their foes. Some hurl blasts of force that crush their victims to paste, while others twist the flow of time itself, or revitalise their brothers with incredible surges of vitality. However they choose to fight, all Librarians are powerful psykers, harnessing the potent mutation they bear as a force to defend Humanity.

upgrades.name: LocatorBeacon
upgrades.description: Causes orbital deployment to not consume action points when deploying adjacent to Scout Bikers or Stormraven Gunships.
upgrades.flavour: Locator beacons are often carried by Scout Bikers or mounted onto Drop Pods, and provide a signalling package, broad-spectrum communicators, and geo-positional tracking. When activated, the beacon uploads detailed positional information to the tactical grid, allowing precision reinforcement by reserve forces.

upgrades.name: MeltaBomb
upgrades.description: Grants Tactical Space Marines, Assault Space Marines, Devastator Space Marines and Scout Bikers the ability to deploy a melta bomb that is highly effective against heavy vehicles and fortifications.
upgrades.flavour: Melta bombs are fusion charges designed to burn through an armoured hull in a matter of seconds.

upgrades.name: Loyalty
upgrades.description: Building that increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: Here the Chaplains tend to the spiritual well-being of their charges, ensuring the discipline of every Marine and keeping their minds and spirits pure. In order to accommodate this, each of the Chapter's ten Companies has its own dedicated chapel. Greater ceremonies take place in the Reclusiam itself.

upgrades.name: MeleeDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Certain Adeptus Astartes chapters—the Space Wolves, the Blood Drinkers, the Minotaurs—are renowned for their mastery of close-quarters combat. To come to blows with even the lowliest Scout Marine from such a chapter is to fight generations of knowledge and training.

upgrades.name: MachineEmpathy
upgrades.description: Chapter tactic that restores the hitpoints of vehicle and fortification units.
upgrades.flavour:
“Consider the Predator. Let your soul be armoured with Faith, driven on the tracks of obedience which overcomes all obstacles, and armed with the three great guns of Zeal, Duty and Purity.”
— Traditional Imperial prayer, source unknown

upgrades.name: Omniscope
upgrades.description: Grants Devastator Centurions the ability to bypass ranged damaged reduction.
upgrades.flavour: Centurions make use of omniscopes to better direct their fearsome firepower and pierce the gloom of a hostile galaxy.

upgrades.name: OrbitalBombardment
upgrades.description: Operation that bombards the target enemy unit.
upgrades.flavour:
“No Exterminatus Extremis order is carried out lightly. To order the death of a planet by Virus Bomb, Cyclonic Torpedo or Atmospheric Incinerator, one must be certain of one's intent. One must accept that millions, even billions, will die so that the rest of humanity may live.”
— Lord High Admiral Soheil, at the scouring of Colchis

upgrades.name: OrbitalDeployment
upgrades.description: Grants units the ability to deploy via drop pod anywhere on the battlefield.
upgrades.flavour: Some units make their way to battle via tunnelling, teleportation, flying or some other extraordinary means which allows them to appear in the thick of the fighting.

upgrades.name: Predator
upgrades.description: Main battle tank unit.
upgrades.flavour: A swift and brutal fighting vehicle, the Predator provides the Space Marine Chapters with prodigious amounts of fire support. The battle tank's heavy bolters and autocannon are the bane of infantry and light vehicles, while the Annihilator variant's lascannons spell doom to any armoured enemy.

upgrades.name: OrbitalScan
upgrades.description: Operation that reveals the target tile and adjacent tiles.
upgrades.flavour: A Space Marine Chapter commonly possesses an entire fleet of ships, ranging from tiny Thunderhawk Gunships to massive Strike Cruisers. On Gladius Prime, the Chapter fleet was decimated by the warp storm. Only one ship survives, swinging around the planet in a low, erratic orbit. Yet for sufficiently important targets, the Techmarine and Servitor crew will focus all its sensors onto the planet's surface.

upgrades.name: PredatorLascannon
upgrades.description: Grants Fortresses of Redemption, Predators and Aquila Macro-Cannons extra Heavy Bolters.
upgrades.flavour: The boltgun, or bolter, fires small missiles known as 'bolts'. Each self-propelled bolt explodes with devastating effect once it has penetrated its target. There are many variations of boltguns, from the short-barreled bolt pistol to the Vulcan mega-bolter often mounted on Titans and other super-heavy vehicles.

upgrades.name: Razorback
upgrades.description: Tank unit that transports infantry.
upgrades.flavour: The Razorback rolls into battle with its weapons charged and ready to fire. Its determined crew slam their vehicle through obstacles and over wreckage, keeping pace with the Adeptus Astartes’ advance. Meanwhile, inside the vehicle’s transport bay, its passengers ready themselves for the battle ahead.

upgrades.name: SiegeMasters
upgrades.description: Chapter tactic that increases the damage of units attacking enemy units in cities and fortifications.
upgrades.flavour:
“A fortress circumvented ceases to be an obstacle. A fortress destroyed ceases to be a threat. Do not forget the difference.”
— Leman Russ, Primarch of the Space Wolves.

upgrades.name: SiegeShield
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of Vindicators and reduces the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
upgrades.flavour: Many Vindicators are equipped with an enormous bulldozer blade, allowing them to shoulder aside battlefield detritus without risk.

upgrades.name: SmokeLauncher
upgrades.description: Grants ground vehicles the ability to launch a smoke screen that increases the ranged damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: Some vehicles have small launchers mounted onto them that carry smoke canisters. These are used to temporarily obscure the vehicle behind billowing clouds of smoke, allowing it to cross open areas in greater safety—although it does so at the cost of being able to fire its own weapons.

upgrades.name: Signum
upgrades.description: Grants Devastator Space Marines the ability to briefly increase their accuracy.
upgrades.flavour: The signum is a communication device that quickly processes and broadcasts targeting data. This ancient piece of technology allows one member of a Space Marine squad to fire with even greater accuracy, battering vital targets with a hail of unerring shots.

upgrades.name: StormravenGunship
upgrades.description: Heavily armed and armoured airborne transport unit.
upgrades.flavour: Stormraven Gunships streak into battle with their weapons blazing, flak whipping around them as they rake the foe with bolts, blasts and warheads. More akin to a flying tank than a conventional dropship, the Stormraven is the most versatile aircraft in the arsenal of the Adeptus Astartes. Fast, manoeuvrable, resilient, boasting prodigious firepower and a substantial transport capacity, the Stormraven can perform many different roles.

upgrades.name: TacticalDoctrine
upgrades.description: Chapter tactic that increases the accuracy of Tactical Space Marines.
upgrades.flavour:
“They shall be pure of heart and strong of body, untainted by doubt and unsullied by self-aggrandisement. They will be bright stars on the firmament of battle, Angels of Death whose shining wings bring swift annihilation to the enemies of Man. So it shall be for a thousand times for a thousand years, unto the very end of eternity and the extinction of mortal flesh.”
— Codex Astartes, by Roboute Guilliman, Primarch of the Ultramarines, Lord Commander and Imperial Regent

upgrades.name: TeleportHomer
upgrades.description: Causes orbital deployment to not consume action points when deploying Terminators adjacent to Tactical Space Marines.
upgrades.flavour: Teleport homers emit a powerful signal enabling orbiting Strike Cruisers to lock onto them with their teleportation equipment. By matching the exact coordinates of this signal, the risk of missing the intended mark is greatly reduced.

upgrades.name: Terminator
upgrades.description: Heavily armoured infantry unit that can take on virtually every ground opponent.
upgrades.flavour: Near invincible and utterly indomitable, Terminators undertake those missions that even their power-armoured brethren cannot. Whether it be an unsupported strike into the heart of an enemy fortress, or hunting super-heavy war engines on foot, these heroic 1st Company Veterans are equal to the task.

upgrades.name: ThunderfireCannon
upgrades.description: Infantry unit that provides long-range barrage support and can clear tiles and repair vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: These colossal, quad-barrelled artillery guns are designed to excel in a static defence role. Each is capable of firing and reloading at a punishing rate, unleashing salvo after salvo of high explosive shells, pounding the enemy into oblivion. Only the brave or the foolish dare advance in the face of such overwhelming and obliterating firepower.

upgrades.name: TheFleshIsWeak
upgrades.description: Chapter tactic that increases damage reduction of infantry units.
upgrades.flavour:
“We have been wounded sorely. Yet still we stand, with fire in our eyes and valour in our hearts. Let them think us beaten. We shall teach them otherwise.”
— Pedro Kantor, Chapter Master of the Crimson Fists

upgrades.name: Vehicles
upgrades.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates requisitions and research.
upgrades.flavour: Home to anything that a Marine might employ to purge the battlefield of xenos and heretics, from the simplest combat knife to the most redoubtable of relics. The Master of Ordnance keeps a close watch upon the Chapter's wargear—only his gene-print can grant access to this titanic underground repository of weapons and vehicles.

upgrades.name: Vindicator
upgrades.description: Heavy tank unit with a devastating close-range cannon.
upgrades.flavour: The Vindicator is a short-ranged sledgehammer of a vehicle, a siege tank whose massive demolisher cannon can reduce any target to a smoking crater. The Vindicator is especially favoured by the Imperial Fists, who regularly field whole squadrons of these tanks and rely upon their concentrated volleys to blast open fortress walls, flatten gun-nests and bunkers, and lay low super-heavy war engines.
